content.description: Climb the right trending dike, clipping 2 bolts, then pull crux on delicate dime edge to reach jug and tie a sling through the obvious hole in the granite, then climb up cracks, flakes, and face with bolts and pro until you reach a sort of a ledge--traverse right into a corner/crack that is another route (Satyriasis, 5.10b+), 15 more feet to the anchor with rap chains. 70m reaches ground.
content.protection: pro to 2"
content.location: look for the obvious dike with 2 bolts close to ground.

content.description: Left bolted route on the vertical face right of the Carson-Kodas Arete. Sustained climbing up sometimes less solid edges and some lichen on last half.
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: Climb Republicans on Crack or other or rappel from top to access. Right wall of the large dihedral up high.

content.description: I am posting this in hopes that someone has more information.
content.protection: Rack for 1st pitch. Seems like a lot of draws for the second. Nice two bolt anchor.
content.location: Between Nosferatu and Organ Grinder.

content.description:
Thin, steep, wild! A memorable route that can be made mostly safe by mega-stick-clipping the first bolt, I thought that was the only really dangerous part.

Some thin and sustained moves lead to and past the first bolt to a roof and the second bolt. Some big holds lead up and left, through some gear placements and then to a couple more bolts. A seriously crazy mantle into a hole will be required that is well protected. Higher, some steep and easy, though unprotected pockets will lead to an anchor.
content.protection: Bolts and a couple finger-sized pieces. Tricams to protect the holes at the top, if desired.
content.location: On the upper bench, a faint dike leads to a scooped out roof.

climbs.name: Trappey's
climbs.fa: Scott Loomis, Mike Fogerty, Katka Loomisva, 1996

content.description: Plenty of closely spaced bolts, then suddenly they end, and seemingly no options for pro; we tried traversing right and left and there was seemingly nothing--ended up leaving a bail biner. See pics.
content.protection: bolts, pro
content.location: Far left/west/upper end of Trapper's south face, around the corner.

content.description: Climb straight up before the end of the wall where the ramp heads up to Midnight Oil. Aim to a high bolt and left to the next bolt following them to the ledge at the same belay spot with gear as Mommy's Little Monster and then follow that same ramp left up to bolts to the end.
content.protection: Bolts and gear anchor and for easy corner
content.location: Near the left end of the Upper Tier main wall, but right of left angling ramp.

content.description: Fun route with the crux past first bolt climb left on small crystal dyke to big hole.
content.protection: Bolts to 2 bolt anchor
content.location: This route is left of Phone Sex Is Safe Sex.

content.description: Right route on the wall facing Carson-Kodas. Fun, more solid, easier start but somewhat harder and a bit more desperate crux section around the 3-4 bolts
content.protection: Bolts
content.location: Right of the right side of the large prominent dihedral at the crag.

content.description:
This would be a pretty good route, but the bolting is kind of whack. It makes sense when you consider it went ground up. But what's left produces horrible rope drag and just kind of takes away from the fun.

Like Afterbirth, gain a dike but keep traversing right, then up through some bolts, then right to a crack/ramp, which leads back left to the anchor.
content.protection: bolts and a couple mid range cams for the easy flake at the top
content.location: Left of Carson-Kodas, same start as Afterbirth in a big open area.

content.description: Start as for Orgasm Addict but follow the corner right, around the end and back left to the same anchors
content.protection: Cams up to 4" and an optional 5" on easy climbing above

content.description:
A great mostly sport route. Amazing rock.

Head up to the roof and place a piece. Take a slight left and climb up on big jugs. Getting to the 4th bolt looks really far but the climbing becomes easy quickly. Technical crux moving past closely spaced 4th and 5th bolts.

Note - pretty easy to setup a TR on routes to the left after climbing this.
content.protection: One #1 for the roof and then 5 bolts to chain anchor.
content.location: Starts off a major ledge 100 ft. off the ground on the right side of Trapper Domes south face. Look for an obvious roof with two bolted lines above. O Addict takes the left one.

content.description: Flake and slabs put you into a wide, left-leaning crack system at the top. Looks tough.
content.protection: Looks big. At least a few >#4 camelot. This is only speculative.
content.location: Left of Carson-Kodas arete. The most striking crack system.

content.description: Scamper directly up the leaning block to a ledge with no gear. Easy but don't blow it. 4 bolts gets you to a roof. Turn the right-facing corner and climb the dihedral. Two more bolts gets you to the glue-in anchor. Deck potential exists if you blow the first, second, and possibly third clip, be aware.
content.protection: Quickdraws and light rack up to ~0.75 camelot.
content.location: Left of Organ Grinder and Psychological Rescue.

content.description: Between the end of the huge flake and Orgasm Addict on the upper tier. Up bolts and over the roof to anchors below the ledge.
content.protection: Bolts and a cam for the roof

content.description: Climb the ramp heading up to Midnight Oil for a short way using optional gear until it is possible to head out right onto the face toward the first bolt. Follow the bolts to a ledge using an additional recommended small piece of gear and either build a belay with gear or continue left up the easy corner either running it out or using gear until the end where more bolt will continue to the top and anchors on a short vertical face just above a large ledge.
content.protection: Bolts with optional gear recommended to reduce rope drag, etc
content.location: At the left end of the Upper tier main vertical section

content.description: Some tricky, thin terrain will lead to a big reach up and right to some good, but steep holds. Hard. Enter a sort of water groove and then some easier, though runout, terrain through cool holes.
content.protection: bolts and maybe some tricams for some holes
content.location: Just left of the obvious roof of orgasm addict

climbs.name: Nancy's Bright Idea
climbs.fa: J. Gonzales, N. Jensen, C. Delker, 7/88

content.description:
Fun liebacking and slab to a wandery finish.

P1 (5.8): 15' of easy slab to a ledge. Lieback the right facing, slightly right leaning crack (5.8). When the crack runs out, clip an old bolt and slab up the low angle arÃªte (5.6). Make your way to the tree up and right to belay..

P2 (5.5?): Enter the dirty gully directly behind the belay tree. Follow it to the top, optionally take the crack heading directly up. Anchor at a tree.
content.protection: Standard rack. One old bolt. Wide gear useful if you'd like to sew up the easy second pitch.
content.location:
Belay from the tree right of Organ Grinder and Republicans on Crack. You'll see the right facing lieback crack with a ledge on the right 10ft up. The crack starts above ~15ft of easy slab to a ledge.

Walk off the back.

content.description: Climb up the start ramp of Mousetrap to easy climbing to the first bolt. Some may want pro to first bolt, Climb up the water runnel to anchors. The rock outside of the water runnel is slick and lead bolts are old! This is a mega a classic at Courtright.
content.protection: Pro-bolts, bolted anchor.
content.location: Midnight Oil is to the left of Mousetrap.

climbs.name: I Wouldn't Want to Be Like You (Always at it!)

content.description: Find the obvious great featured face above a little roof 15' up near the right end of the upper tier. Start the same as Orgasm Addict but follow the bolt line to the right.
content.protection: Bolts and a 0.5 or 0.75 or 1 camalot or crash pad
content.location: Right of Orgasm Addict

content.description: Face climb followed by pockets and a large crack. Can be don using only the bolts but the top section (easy) is run out.
content.protection: Bolts, cam for the upper section
content.location: It is in the first section of the upper tier wall, right after the bolted easy ramp.

content.description: Start off the left side of the huge flake near the right end of the upper tier and go past 2 bolts to finish up the corner of Real Men Don't Kill Coyotes.
content.protection: Up to 3"

content.description:
A great name. The crux is well protected but the easy top part is quite runout.

Shares the start with millions of dead cops, hard and tricky climbing past a couple bolts. When able, head left along a seam and quickly enter the crux. A super big iron cross/campus is first required, then a tough mantle using some pockets. Then another really hard reach back right will get you to some easier terrain.
content.protection: Nice petzl long life bolts at the crux, quarter inchers up higher. Maybe some tricams for some holes
content.location: Just left of the obvious roof of orgasm addict.

climbs.name: Claim Jumper
climbs.fa: John Gonzales, Tanya Novak, Gerry Cox, July 1992

content.description: Face climb to a dike, then traverse left. Crux is getting to the dike.
content.protection: Bolts, bolted anchor
content.location: Look for the dike right above a face, just to the right of a small seam.

content.description: Easy, well bolted slab.
content.protection: 6 bolts, chain anchor
content.location: One of the first routes you encounter as you head up the slop to the upper tier of Trapper's south face.

climbs.name: Carson-Kodas Arete
climbs.fa: Ron Carson and Vaino Kodas, July 1987

content.description:
A Brief History of 'Carson-Kodas'....

In July 1987, when they put up this route, Ron Carson and Vaino Kodas were two of the best and boldest climbers in the area. Ron's routes on Dome Rock (Carsonoma and Chemotherapy, etc.) are legendary 5.12+ power slabs. By this time he had also led "The Dark Side" (5.12 R/X) on Voodoo Dome, and he would go on to complete the amazing "Titanic" in The Needles with Tony Yaniro and Brett Maurer. Vaino Kodas, one of the Estonians (along with Eve Laeger) of the Power Dome classic "Esto Power", established difficult new routes throughout California at a frenzied pace until moving out of the area a few years ago.

Climbing in traditional style, with the bolts drilled by a climber on the lead, this strong team established a route which stands as a testpiece at it's grade. The exhilaration which comes with a successful ascent of this pitch will leave you wanting more, even if it was a bit scary.

THE BETA:

As is obvious from the belay, the route face climbs up and over to the arete. Climbing the arete is airy and exciting, but most climbers will find the crux to be a sequence of face moves encountered after the second bolt.

From the belay, climb up easily and clip the first bolt (A large nut with a long runner can provide optional protection for these opening moves). The next bit, up to the second bolt, is 5.10. The last couple moves to the clipping (drilling) stance require skillful footwork and are probably the worst place on the route to fall. After the second bolt, you traverse left and up, through the crux, arriving at the arete just below a small overhang and the third bolt. While doing the crux you must again climb well away from the pro, but this time your potential fall is safe and clean. The next section ascends the exposed arete. You cannot see the last bolt until you get to it (If you are climbing with double ropes, you can place a decent small wired nut in the patina on the face to the right.) In either case, a couple hard moves over the little roof lead to easier moves above and then - surprise - that 4th bolt. There is no fixed anchor, but excellent nut placements and other things to tie off to are found at the top.

KRIS SOLEM'S INSIGHT:

"My own experiences with this climb have been varied. I've led it several times. I've also backed off it more than once, either because I wasn't feeling solid or it was too hot. This route is R rated - it's not a death defying stunt, but you could take a real flyer coming off in the wrong place, so use your head. If conditions are good and you're feeling it, do the deed. When you are through the crux and arrive at the arete proper, take a good look around and savor the exposure. It's one of a kind.

If your second is someone you like, you might consider pulling the rope up through the gear and tossing it back down in the clear to TR the traverse.

This is not a good route to try on a warm day in the hot sun!"
content.protection:
-60m rope

-Pro to #2, small nuts helpful

-(5) draws

-slings and biners for gear
content.location:
The Carson Kodas Arete is a great line on perfect granite with wild exposure at a challenging grade. This fine pitch ascends the prominent arete which forms the south west corner of Trapper Dome. This formation is across the road from Trapper Springs campground and is a five minute walk from the car.

The route begins at a bolted belay stance one pitch off the ground on a ledge under the large dihedral to the right of the arete. This spot can be reached by climbing one of several routes leading up to the ledge, or you can hike up the back of the dome and rapell in from anchors across from the arete.
